Contraindications: Concurrent strong CYP3A4 inhibitors; severe hepatic impairment

Titration_Schedule: PRN; max 200mg/day; do not drive for 8 hours
Contraindications: Driving restriction for 8 hours post-dose
Step_Therapy_Class_Count: Ditan class (non-vasoconstrictor) - requires 2 triptan failures unless contraindication

Titration_Schedule: Increase by 80mg every 3-7 days; ECG required at doses >480mg; max 960mg/day
Common_AEs_Leading_to_Discontinuation: Constipation; bradycardia; hypotension; edema; heart block (dose-dependent)
Contraindications: Sick sinus syndrome; 2nd/3rd degree AV block; severe LV dysfunction; hypotension; concurrent beta-blockers (relative)
Step_Therapy_Class_Count: Primary cluster preventive - counts as 1 cluster step
Source_Citation: AHS Cluster Headache Guidelines 2016; Robbins MS et al. Headache 2016;56:1093-1106

Titration_Schedule: Increase by 120-240mg every 3-7 days; ECG monitoring required >480mg
Contraindications: Sick sinus syndrome; AV block; severe LV dysfunction; hypotension
Step_Therapy_Class_Count: Primary cluster preventive - counts as 1 cluster step

Titration_Schedule: Adjust based on serum levels (0.6-1.2 mEq/L); check levels after 5-7 days; renal/thyroid monitoring required
Common_AEs_Leading_to_Discontinuation: Tremor; polyuria/polydipsia; weight gain; hypothyroidism; renal impairment; cognitive dulling
Contraindications: Significant renal impairment; severe cardiovascular disease; dehydration; sodium depletion; pregnancy
Step_Therapy_Class_Count: Cluster preventive - counts as 1 cluster step
Source_Citation: AHS Cluster Headache Guidelines 2016; Level B evidence

Evidence_Level: Level A for EPISODIC cluster (FDA approved 2019)
Titration_Schedule: Fixed 300mg monthly dosing; no titration; ideally start at cluster onset
Common_AEs_Leading_to_Discontinuation: Injection site reactions; injection site pruritus
Contraindications: Hypersensitivity; ⚠️ NOT indicated for CHRONIC cluster headache (Phase 3 failed)
Step_Therapy_Class_Count: ⭐ ONLY FDA-APPROVED CGRP FOR CLUSTER - requires verapamil/lithium failure at most payers
Source_Citation: FDA Approval June 2019; Goadsby PJ et al. NEJM 2019;381:132-141

Titration_Schedule: PRN for acute attacks; max 2 injections/24 hours (12mg); minimum 1 hour between doses
Common_AEs_Leading_to_Discontinuation: Injection site reactions; chest tightness; triptan sensations
Contraindications: CV disease; uncontrolled HTN; hemiplegic migraine; concurrent ergots/MAOIs
Step_Therapy_Class_Count: First-line acute cluster treatment (with oxygen)
Source_Citation: AHS Cluster Headache Guidelines 2016; Level A evidence for SC route

Common_Starting_Dose: 12-15 L/min via non-rebreather mask for 15-20 minutes
Titration_Schedule: PRN for acute attacks; 15-20 minute treatment duration; may repeat
Common_AEs_Leading_to_Discontinuation: None significant; fire hazard with smoking
Contraindications: COPD with CO2 retention (relative); smoking near oxygen (fire risk)
Step_Therapy_Class_Count: First-line acute cluster treatment (with SC sumatriptan)
Source_Citation: AHS Cluster Headache Guidelines 2016; Cohen AS et al. JAMA 2009;302:2451-2457

Titration_Schedule: Start high then taper over 2-3 weeks (e.g., 60mg x 4d then decrease by 10mg every 3-4 days)
Common_AEs_Leading_to_Discontinuation: Insomnia; mood changes; hyperglycemia; GI upset; weight gain
Contraindications: Active infection; uncontrolled diabetes; psychosis history; peptic ulcer disease
Step_Therapy_Class_Count: Transitional/bridge therapy while titrating verapamil - not counted as preventive failure
Source_Citation: AHS Cluster Headache Guidelines 2016; Level C evidence; used as bridge therapy
